title: Senior Functional Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions:
It was 2 1-hour panel interviews (back to back) via Zoom. Questions were very easy, in fact, I was expecting more technical questions. I knew I was overqualified for the role, but I thought I'd try it since the work involves end to end business process improvements. 

It happened nearly 3 weeks ago.  I followed up with the Program Assistant last week for any kind of update, and I didn't hear back. I followed up again this week, and I didn't hear back yet again.   

For an educational institution, I expected better...professionalism. I can take 'nay' - I've hired people in the past for Fortune 500 companies. I really just needed to hear back as a courtesy.
Interview Questions:
Why UW?
What project methodologies have you worked with?
How would you organize Sharepoint?
etc...

title: Program Operations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone screening with someone from UW HR and then about a week later a member of the Program Ops. team reached out and scheduled an interview. The interview was via Zoom and divided up into two parts. One 30 minute session with the program manager and then another 45 minute session with the manager and the 6 person team. Each team member asked me a behavioral interview question and then after that I was given the opportunity to ask my questions. I felt like the interview went really well and everyone was extremely nice...unfortunately after that I was completely ghosted. I fallowed up twice with the team member that set up the interview and twice with the program manager. I never herd back from anyone, they didn't even respond to my emails, which I find extremely unprofessional. I never herd back about the position so I assumed that I didn't get it and moved on to other offers.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you took initiative.

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Hiring manager reached out with a series of questions to answer over email. Coding challenge was requested (took 6 hrs), before a half day of interviewing which took 3.5 hours.
Interview Questions:
Describe a time when you utterly messed up a project?
Where do you learn about new technical concepts?

title: Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Tacoma, WA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was a very long process with many interviews from phone interview, to panel (via Zoom or teams due to the pandemic) then eventually with direct supervisor (depending on situation might be via zoom, teams or in-person). my position also required a presentation during the panel interview.
Interview Questions: Prepare a presentation regarding how you might assist in supporting students.

title: Development Specialist Role Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: I have been interviewing for various roles with UW in their fundraising and have had different experiences but overall, the people have been responsive and straightforward. I'd say it's interesting how varied the interview formats are - in general, once you make it past the first phone call you will be put in multiple group interview situations which can be tough but also useful to get to see how different employees interact, especially with their boss.
Interview Questions: What are three words that describe you?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Filling out an online form, then speaking with prospective supervisor on a  telephone call. It didn't sound like a challenging job. The pay was low and there was no parking available.
Interview Questions: I was asked to give describe how I would prioritize a set of given tasks.

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Washington, DC) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is a multi-stage process for hiring new employees. The interview process typically includes the following steps: writing a job description, posting a job, scheduling interviews, conducting preliminary interviews, conducting in-person interviews, following up with candidates and making a hire.
Interview Questions: What do you consider to be your greatest strengths?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Spring Seat, TX) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was ok buy not sure if it took that long to process those components. Why do you want this job? Really why not not.  It was ok buy not sure if it took that long to process those components. Why do you want this job? Really why not not.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: The interview was straightforward and short-- questions weren't too easy or too hard. Interview was around half an hour long. The interview was conducted by the PI and another lab member.
Interview Questions: How are you qualified for the role

title: Director of Marketing & Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Online application; initial 30 minute phone screening; then two one-hour panels in person on campus. Recommend you leave plenty of time to find parking and be patient with wayfinding.
Interview Questions: Describe three characteristics you would bring to this role.

title: Computer Vet Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was a panel of three people who interviewed me. They asked me a lot about my experience with technology and customer service. They were particularly interested in whether I kept up with current technology. They also asked about how I work in a team and whether I can follow procedures. They also asked me to explain how to update a mac operating system by memory.
Interview Questions: If you didn't know how to solve a tech problem how would you find the solution?

title: HR Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: There is one in person interview and then they will call again if they have additional questions after interviewing other candidates. After this, they will contact you with an offer or will not reach out again.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do after graduating and how would this position help you?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: The professor made a call to me, then we discuss for around 30min. I got the offer immediately. But the professor gave me one week to consider this offer. I said Yes after one week. Basically it's very easy and smooth. It's up to the professor.
Interview Questions: What's your research plan

title: Program Operations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Phone screen interview two weeks after I applied online:  Interviewer was friendly and got to business right away.  She had a pre-set list of questions and then I was offered an opportunity to ask my own.   Conversation was more natural at the end of the session.  
This position only paid $55-65k which was quite low in my opinion, for the job description that was posted.  
I sent a thank you e-mail the same afternoon and received an e-mail back the next day letting me know I was not selected to move on to the next phase of interviews.  Very professional.
Interview Questions:
1.  Describe these three words:  RESOURCEFUL, DEPENDABLE, SELF-MOTIVATED.
2.  Describe how you are "detail oriented."
3.  Describe a challenging change in your work
4.  Why are you interested in UW Med?
5.  Standard questions to clarify items on resume.

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions:
Very interesting, get to know each other. The interviewer focused on how the team and I can be both benefited if I get hired.
Later he became my direct supervisor. So we are on same page of what he wants from me and what I want from this position.
Interview Questions: How can we reach a win-win situation.

title: Business Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Initial 15-minute phone screening with the hiring manager and panel (7 people) interview.  After going through this time consuming process, ,I  wouldn't apply for a regular full-time position at UW since they probably have an internal candidate (or someone's friend), but they still have to interview people (which is a waste everyone's time)!
Interview Questions: How do you work with diverse groups of people (I was asked this question by a panel of 85% white people)?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3+ months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very informal and structure-less. I did not get many questions about the work that I have done and the questions were very vague and hard to answer.
Interview Questions: What part did you like the most about the research?

title: Web Producer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview with hiring manager, then brought into an in-person interview with a group of people. Afterwards met briefly with director of the division. Got hired a couple of days later.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you've had to work with many different types of people.

title: Strategic Marketing & Communications Team Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Took about seven weeks for a response and get a phone interview, which was about 30-45 minutes in length.  Even after I followed up, it took another seven weeks to get a response. In-person interview took place the following week at my own cost (I do not live in Washington state). Group interview went well; nice people. I followed up with personalized thank you’s to everyone. No response. After three weeks I reached out. I was then told they offered the position to another candidate. I realize everyone is busy but a courtesy email would have been nice to let me know their decision.
Interview Questions: The university embraces diversity.  What techniques would you use to ensure diversity in this role?

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied for a position posted online I fully qualified for. Endless back and forth questionnaires. Ended up applying elsewhere, interviewing, negotiating wage and almost starting before they could do anything.
Interview Questions: How well can you write code?

title: Lab Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: The interview process involved an online application, and in-person interview, and a panel group interview. The interviewers were very informative about the position, and the team was very helpful overall. They sent us emails ahead of time with some information on how to prepare.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working in Lab Services?

title: HR Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen followed by two seperate interviews. Met with multiple members of the team. Had the opportunity to ask questions at all stages. Interviewers came prepared and answered my questions honestly.
Interview Questions: What area would i have the biggest learning curve.

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: About a 15- 20 minute meeting with the professor you will work under. You will be asked questions about your experiences and why you are a good fit to be a TA for this course specifucally.
Interview Questions: How would you go about answering a student question and their confusion about a topic?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Before the interview, my advisor gave me a written exam. During the interview, he asked me questions concerning the exams and also some other coding and computer skills. The process is smooth.
Interview Questions: What is the longest scripts you have ever written? What coding language do you use mostly?

title: Student IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview was set up by email and met the manager and assistant manager after reaching their office. They asked me basic IT questions but didn’t care if I knew the right answers as long as I was willing to learn. Overall a positive experience for my first job
Interview Questions: Do you know what DNS is?

title: Laboratory Animal Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was the best interview I have ever had. I feel like we didn’t just go through those standard questions, instead we discussed about it, and really get to know each other.
Interview Questions: How can we achieve a win-win situation?

title: Research Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was straight forward. One phone screen, one in-person with the hiring manager and meeting with the team (1:1) with 3-4 employees. General questions about skill-set, education and experience were asked. However paperwork took way too long than expected (2 months)
Interview Questions: Do you have any coding experience?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Classic itinerary. One on ones with upper management and group meetings with the teams. Tour into the labs and where the instruments are with any questions you have. I would say the questions weren't difficult, there were behavioral questions and some technical questions.
Interview Questions: They asked me questions that in retrospect, were more about me understanding the bigger picture instead of the assays I made or optimized.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Talk to my advisor directly. He asked me some questions regarding my former work experience, my research topics and some achievements. He brought me to his lab and the office and asked me whether like the environment or not.
Interview Questions: Can you describe your research experience?

title: ASUW Bike Shop Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by ASUW personnel along with bike shop employees. Asked experience with managing as well as interpersonal skills. The interview process lasted about 30 minutes, conversations were on the lighter side.
Interview Questions: How to take off the head tube of a bicycle??

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Interview #1 is basic phone screen, interview #2 is typically leadership, and interview #3 is the culture interview, where your coworkers would interview you. Your manager should be at interviews #1 and #2.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you were managing different priorities with different deadlines.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed for a position under the Mental Health Department on First Hill. Parking was unfortunately not validated, but the parking lot was easy to find despite the traffic. I was brought into the interview room and was interviewed by the head of the program that they were starting along with her assistant. Both were friendly and down to earth and asked great questions, talked about the culture in their department, showed me the work space and talked about follow up. It was a great interview process.
Interview Questions: What were you daily responsibilities in your previous position?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: The interview process at the University of Washington takes weeks, or sometimes months! The first step is a phone interview, followed by an in person panel. Depending on the job, you may be brought back for a third interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you improved a system using technology.

title: Medical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: One round of interviews with a manager and another social worker. Questions were standard but they hire internally often . So you have to join their per diem pool. Takes about an hour but the process is slow From start to finish.
Interview Questions: Case study question about abuse.

title: Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (University Place, WA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very easygoing and casual. Start out with a group interview process, followed by a personality interview to see if you are the right fit. Overall very fair and very casual, Yusuke was a very kind interviewer, generally just wants to get to know the future employee better.
Interview Questions: Do you have a driver's license?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Called in after submitting resume and interviewed, was hired a few days later. The interview was fast and easy. It was fairly informal and only included my direct boss. The department was a good fit and the interview was casual and friendly.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working in this department?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Washington, DC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: sat at a table across from two directors and they asked a bunch of questions and i answered and then they asked more questions and i answered more questions and i asked more questions
Interview Questions: what do you like to do

title: Research Scientist/Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Just met people in the lab after a phone call about job expectations. Hired after communicating with PI over email about expectations. Mostly based on interest rather than quizzing on experience.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do after being a technician?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got contacted via email for a phone interview with hiring manager, then the hiring manager followed up with me via email for a second interview  in person.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Production Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Must apply online using UW’s hiring website, applications are selected based off algorithmic compatibility with “minimum qualifications” before they are sent along to the hiring manager. Took about a month to speak with someone, ended up guessing the correct hiring manager and reaching out through email, which got me an interview. Didn’t hear back for two weeks after that.
Interview Questions: How do you keep yourself organized?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews, 1 being a phone interview. Everyone was very nice and seemed very happy to be giving an interview. Great company to work for and lots of room for growth. Benefits were top notch and husky u-pass was offered as well. If you can start low in pay, it is a great place to get in.
Interview Questions: What was an uncomfortable situation you ever experienced with a co-worker and how did you handle it?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed in the offices of a scientific laboratory in the Anthropology department. The process was informal and informative. The director of the lab conducted the interview and provided training in chemical processing and data modeling in addition to the training provided by the graduate student who ran the lab.
Interview Questions: Schedule flexibility/duration of availability

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: My interview was with two lab Program Managers along with  an Operations Manager. I also met a few other key members of the lab management team. The interview lasted a few hours and included more conversation than questions.
Interview Questions: How do you handle competing priorities?

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone screen with two members of the hiring committee followed by a panel interview with 5 staff members. In both interviews, I was asked standard questions for a CM role. During both interviews, I found several things concerning as a prospective employee. 1) The staff seemed unhappy and unfriendly to each other, 2)  During the time for open questions, each staff member over-shared frustrations about their departments and jobs, 3) one staff member complained about other colleagues and faculty across the university. The negativity was unexpected and helped me screen out this position and department from consideration.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience in crisis communications?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was very unorganized.  They did not keep me informed of where I was in the process and what the next steps would be.  I didn't know who I was interviewing with.
Interview Questions: Budgeting experience

title: Department Operations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a great experience, they usually have a review committee (3-5 people) everyone was friendly, the questions were easy and give the chance to extend about my experience. After some days they call me!
Interview Questions:
Tell us about your self
Tell us about a mistake and how you handle it

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was typical to most other jobs that I have interviewed for, but there are several stages from meeting with just the hiring manager to being interviewed by the whole staff or that department.
Interview Questions: How have you managed a situation of conflict in the workplace?

title: Predoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Met with 5 different PIs to discuss their research. Didn't seem too interested in what I was working on but more about whether or not I could be interested in working for them.
Interview Questions: If you got an offer, would you attend?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got an email about setting up a phone screen 2 days later. Went in for the in-person interview a few days later. Interview was pretty informal compared to other jobs I've interviewed for. Two group/panel-style interviews with 3 people each, first one was a very casual getting-to-know-you interview, second was a technical interview focused on my skills, and I did a test with the group in the room. Then the group left the room and I took a second test. I came out of the interview room and got a tentative offer on the spot. Got an official offer the next week after discussing logistics and having a couple of phone calls with other people in the department. Obviously interviews will vary by department, so not every research group necessarily will interview in this format.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had to write documentation for a technical task?

title: PSS Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: It was great and they were very friendly. They have a list of questions that they ask and it’s pretty basic questions. They were a little informal and very pleasant.
Interview Questions: Asked if you wirked with someone difficult

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: A brief 30 to 40 min phone interview where they tell you a little bit about the lab and the position expectations, followed by an in person interview.  The in person interview can last 1 to 2 hours depending on how many people they want you to meet.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?  Tell us about yourself?  Future plans and goals?

title: Fiscal Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Open discussion oriented interview. Good positive experience. Group/panel setup. Process takes 4 weeks overall. Few email exchanges before interview. There was only a single round. Did not get to meet other Candidates who applied for the same role.
Interview Questions: What are you future plans?

title: Telecommunications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone screen. The process took 20 min. They went over my resume. The recruiter didn't ask anything about why I am interested in the job. It was.a waste of time
Interview Questions: Try kept asking for.question s on my resume. I  has ask about experience. They didn't answer questions about benefits or salary.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Easy just basic question about past experience, friendly face, what you want from job, very informal with lots of just talking easily and having  a basic conversation where you just tell about yourself and ask them about the position
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself 
Why do you want this job

title: HUB Information Services Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions:
Group interview process with 5 other people present. Laid back, but I would say this depends on what type of students you are interviewing with in your group.

Expect multiple interviewers as well. Make sure to engage with each one of them to help stand out with other candidates. And do not forget to smile or tell a small joke, you will be working with these people and they are looking to see someone who wants to be a team player.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Embryologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: they asked my experience, why i choose UW, what is the most important things for being embryologist, and what makes you want to be a embryologist. Then we talked about the seattle and what makes seattle is a great place to live
Interview Questions: What is your weakness

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the research coordinator.  It took less than an hour. The interviewer was really nice and when I worked there, everyone else was nice and professional. So the interview process and experience should be similar no matter who’s conducting.
Interview Questions: Why was I interested to work at this lab? What interested me about autism?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Series of phone interviews and in person interviews. The entire process took about one month and was fairly straight forward. The HR representative did a good job with staying in touch, however, they kept losing my paperwork and I would have to resubmit.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Grad Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with 5 different professors for 20m each. Asked me about my research and they talked about their research. Not many actual questions. Afterwards had a group  happy hour and the next day went to breweries with current grad students.
Interview Questions: Where on a chromosome does a microtubule attach during mitosis?

title: Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Expect a very formalized process with a predetermined script of questions. They were mostly about the job's specific qualifications and responsibilities. Thier were four people interviewing me as they alternated which questions to ask.
Interview Questions: What part of the position do you feel most qualified for? Least Qualified?

title: Business Operations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview then panel of 5 (did not expect this was assuming a one on one preliminary and did not have enough additional resumes with me) . Well thought out questions, comfortable process
Interview Questions: They inquired about budgeting experience

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Because you are having an interview with a Professor, it is usually pretty comfortable, and almost feels like a regular office hour. They ask about your past teaching experiences which I think is fine if you don't have great experiences. I referenced my tutoring experiences but if you are taking PSYCH 496, it is okay to just express your interest and why you would be a good fit for that course specifically.
Interview Questions: How would you help out a student if they told you they can't phrase the question right or that they are too confused to know what they are even confused about?

title: Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied via HuskyJobs, was contacted a week later, brief phone screening, then in person interview with 2 managers of department. I'm sure this experience varies a lot based on the department you are applying to.
Interview Questions: Asked about previous relevant experience.

title: Research Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I met with the head of the lab over lunch and we talked about my previous experience and education, and she told me about the lab and their expectations. It was a very laid back interview that lasted around two hours. Only half an hour was dedicated to actual interview questions. The rest of the time was spent talking to each other and getting a tour around the facilities.  I do not think this was a typical interview though, as I met with the head of lab directly, and did not go through their website application.
Interview Questions: What was your previous laboratory experience like?

title: HR Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a positive experience. They New my profesional background based on my resume and were more interested about my personality and behavioral skills to see if I would be a good fit which I think is really important.
Interview Questions: What are some qualities you look for when working with a team?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: First there was a phone call where i was told more about the position. They wanted to know my schedule for summer quarter and since summer was their busy season they wanted to confirm whether i would be here during summer. Scheduled an on site interview.  Basic personality questions were asked during the on site interview. At the end of the interview they wanted 2 referrals and gave me sometime to turn them in.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your self, can you work independently, strengths, weaknesses, time management, how did you handle a situation where there was a disagreement b/w u and your co-worker,

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: I emailed the PI. A few days later, the PI emailed me and scheduled a skype interview. I interviewed with the PI (about 40 minutes), and had some email follow-up afterwards. I got the offer (email) a few days later.
Interview Questions: mostly about my research project during my PhD training, and my future research interest.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: I came in one day and interviewed with a few members of the group one-on-one, then spoke with the director of the research group. The interviews with the team members ranged from technical white-boarding code questions to general culture fit discussions. The discussion with the directory focused on what I would be doing there, the projects, and where the team was headed.
Interview Questions: Explain some simple operations with linked lists.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Short but meaningful interview process about skill and previous experience. Relevant questions were asked. Email response in the slower side but otherwise a good experience. Did not feel uncomfortable at all during the time I was being interviewed.
Interview Questions: What experience did you have in reception and what challenges did you face and how did you respond?

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: There wasn't such a interview process, just chatting asking about you have previous experience on customer service parts such like that. The lady I chatted with was really kind and helpful. She thought me briefly about the job I will do
Interview Questions: Do you have previous experience for customer service?

title: Security Guard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Apply online at UW Hires.  Then there will usually be a phone interview. If that is successful, there will be a panel interview with between 3 & 5 people.
Interview Questions: The usual questions. Lots of situational.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with supervisor and HR manager where they asked me about my experience as well as my future goals, they described what the job would entail. Then had in person interview with supervisor and other managers I would be working with.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to work with someone difficult

title: TEACHERS ASSISTANT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed over the phone and on person.  The phone was with one person and the meeting was with two.  In the meeting with the one person, he said I had it.  Then I ended up not getting it.  Bad look, UW.
Interview Questions: What plans do you have to make the material teachable

title: Information Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute walk in Interview. Sat with 2 managers and they asked a series of behavior-related interview questions! The questions were not too difficult, be prepared to show yourself as a customer oriented person!
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a disgruntled client?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Washington, DC) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: very straight forward and based on practical experience. You are required to identify your strength in past projects and what you would do differently if given the chance. You are also required to have an understanding of the present research, although not much is needed.
Interview Questions: talk about previous project

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by hiring coordinator to inform me that I was a candidate as well as to answer a few scenario-based question in essay format. Then, I was scheduled for an in-person interview with the coordinator and the supervisor.
Interview Questions: How to do you handle working with numerous of students with varying needs and inquiries?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: dk I applied over the phone by calling in. I hear many people are recruited through the UW tour guides department as well, which works closely with the representatives department and the people that interview us.
Interview Questions: What is your other experience?

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: good but was too long. This is USA, the process is difficult and needs a smart one. Also, I remember that they are using smart Pcs as an AI to see your reactions.
Interview Questions: Are you smart or not?

title: Technology Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Not particularly smooth. Work needs to be done on streamlining the process and keeping folks focused on the task at hand. The interview is also for the org, so an effort should be made by employees to make the org look professional and like a desirable place to work.
Interview Questions: How would you support or protect your employees against competing demands from upper management.

title: Student Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Washington (Tacoma, WA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the instructor who taught me Data Structures.  She only teaches one section of that class for undergrads per year and she remembered me from the year before.  So there was no interview the job just fell into my lap really.
Interview Questions: Do you want to work as my grader?

title: Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with 3 participants.  In person 3 rounds of interviews.  First panel had 10 people, 2nd had 5 and 3rd had 10.  Each panel touched upon different aspects of the role.
Interview Questions: What do you think one of your areas of weakness is?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied through online and got a request within a week for a phone interview. I have interviewed with a director for 30 min. It was right before the Christmas season and I got back in Jan?
Interview Questions: intro yourself

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very simple. A preliminary screening call with the HR recruiter, then a 30 minute face to face interview with a panel of employees. I applied to the role online, which required completion of a few short answer responses, cover letter, and resume. Each round of interviews was a bit repetitive, as the recruiter and panel asked the same questions, but overall very simple.
Interview Questions: The typical interview questions - why this role; strengths/weaknesses; where you see yourself in 5 years; your working style.

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Had a great phone interview and was really optimistic. Was told I'd receive a second interview and it never happened. Inquired about the job, no response, eventually got told weeks later they had filled the position already. Very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: What interested you in this position?

title: Student Dining Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview required. You just have to apply online and submit the time schedule you are able to work. If they need people to work at certain time and your availability matches with theirs, they will email you.
Interview Questions: NA

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for two interviews the first with Post Docs I would be working with and the second with the head of the Lab.  The first interview was more technical, while the second was more of a meet and greet.
Interview Questions: Specifics of the projects I would be working on.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Overall a positive experience. I prepped well and felt good about the process and the people conducting it. First was the telephone interview, then the in-person interview, and finally a presentation to the team about why I would be a good fit.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you dealt with adversity

title: Custodian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: They were very thorough and had actually read my resume and didn't ask me questions that were already addressed there.  It was very refreshing.  They even quizzed me on some of the more obscure talents I had listed and skipped over a group of questions because I obviously had a handle on those skills and they didn't need to find out any more from me.
Interview Questions: How would I handle an unexpected issue?

title: Media Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: First of all, you would introduce yourself briefly. Then the interviewer will ask general questions about your experience of using media equipment, especially digital cameras, recording equipment and microphone. The interview is about 5 mins.
Interview Questions: Have you used the media equipment before?

title: Student Athletic Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Great conversation with the assistant coach of the team. I'd already developed a relationship with the team through previous work, so the official interview process for becoming the team manager was more of an informal conversation.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be the student manager?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: I had to follow up allot to get the initial interview which was very casual & went very well.  I was asked back to a much more formal  interview. With the whole team we're I was basically reinterviewed by 5 different people.  The most difficult question which should have been easy was "why do you want to work here?"  I had a tough time having the answer not sound cheesy & canned.  I practiced several responses but the delivery was difficult under pressure.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to want to work here?

title: Business Services Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Seven interviewers, round-robin questions; held in an interview room with questions on finance experience (Business operations experience), customer service experience, process improvement experience, and interactive personnel discussion and issue resolution experience
Interview Questions: How would you deal with customer service issues?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was rather informal but that’s because I have a long history with the organization and the process itself was really more of a formality. I was contacted, asked for a letter of rec and then had to provide references along with give a presentation.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching methodology?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process, rather just an application. The school is in no way easy to get into as I have heard a lot of friends did not receive offers. Write a really good admissions paper and take an active role.
Interview Questions: There was no interview process, rather just an application. The school is in no way easy to get into as I have heard a lot of friends did not receive offers. Write a really good admissions paper and take an active role.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was 30min, everything was straight to the point and efficient. However, they took a slightly longer time to get back to me about the offer. I think it helped that I constantly visited the hiring manager's office to inquire about the status of my application.
Interview Questions: Have you worked in a team before? What were the ups and downs?

title: Resident Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of four interviews before an offer. I made it through three of these interviews before my candidacy was completed. There was an initial phone interview and then two Skype interviews (depending on the time of the year, your interviews may be in person at The Placement Exchange). The final interview would be an on-campus interview. Each interview was subsequently longer and more in-depth. When I was eliminated from the process, the lead on the search team offered me feedback in a phone call, which was hard to take, but ultimately helpful for my job search.
Interview Questions: How would you describe your supervisory style?

title: Student Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Washington (Tacoma, WA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Board interview where questions were asked related to the job. I was in a conference room with a comfortable atmosphere and very friendly staff. There were three of the administrators at the interview where they would all ask questions about my person and work background.
Interview Questions: Do you like to work in a team?

title: Maintenance Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Asked about future goals for after college. Wanted to make sure that classes and coursework came before work. Hours were very flexible and accommodated school and other life events. Wanted to make sure that I was going to be a reliable worker and be able to get things done.
Interview Questions: What are you studying and how do you plan to use this in future jobs?

title: HR Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easy process, hiring manager was very transparent about the role and future development opportunities (or lack there of in the department). Which was fine, but I appreciated the truth. Received an offer, but it was too low so I declined.
Interview Questions: How do you see yourself contributing to the team?

title: Senior Computer Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: A panel interview with 6 people with a 45 minute presentation for a proposal on a simulated project. Total interview was 4 hours long and included the presentation, interview with a panel, interview with director and executive director, meeting with customer panel, and internal team panel.
Interview Questions: How do your skills apply to the overall mission and goals of the department

title: Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: I declined to have an interview. The recruiter woman seriously needs a refresher in email etiquette. Based on her responses, I didn't get the impression that I want to work there.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Cleaner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions:
The manager asked general questions related to behavioral and asked me if I can lift 50 lbs.
What is the earliest date to start?
Why you want this job?
This a very easy interview process.
Interview Questions: Why you want this job

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Washington in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had the opportunity to fill-in for someone during a summer class. When that person left the university, they invited me to apply for the role. I had one panel interview with 4 faculty and staff. It lasted about an hour. It was very friendly. Questions related to relevant experiences delivering presentations, delivering feedback.
Interview Questions: Provide an example of time you had to deliver feedback to student or client? What is your approach to developing training content?

title: Records Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
This was for a Records Analyst position in the Records Management Services department. I applied online and was contacted about a week or two later for a phone interview. After the phone interview, an in-person panel interview with 6 people was scheduled (a little over the top if you ask me). The interview itself was fine -- almost every question was aimed to have you provide an example in your work experience.

After all of this, I was offered the job. Only AFTER the job was offered did the manager ask me when I could begin working. She was not happy with my response and proceeded to scold me and tell me it was my fault for not supplying that information sooner. She continued to insult me for about 5 minutes until she calmed herself down and asked if we could continue the conversation the next day. When we spoke the next day, she asked if "I had any thoughts about our conversation" aka did I come to my senses and bow to her will. She gave me an ultimatum about my start date and I said it wouldn't work so she rescinded the job offer.

There were other major red flags about the manager that I had questioned, so all-in-all, really glad I'm not working there and would not recommend this department to anyone until they get a new manager. VERY unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when a project did not go as planned.

title: Research Scientist/Engineer - Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was an informal interview. Everyone in the lab were super friendly. There weren't really any hard questions. The interviewers respect and listen to my answer. Overall, the experience was good.
Interview Questions: What is your expectation for the job?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: they call you then set up an interview. you come to their office. they then ask you questions about your experiences and why you want to work here. they will also ask you surprise question and what do you know about them so be ready to answer
Interview Questions: typical question

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Really no formal interview as the Professor was a member of my doctoral committee. He was familiar with my skill set and knowledge, so there really was no formal interview.
Interview Questions: The interviewer was a member of my doctoral committee, so was quite familiar with my knowledge base.

title: Operations Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Rescinded interview offer due to fictitious job announcement  and wasn't going to waste my time interviewing for a job that I had absolutely no chance of getting.  Some departments, not all, have some very unscrupulous people that are in upper management that don't represent the University very well.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Video Producer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
University of Washington Advancement department. 
Process was smooth and efficient through the interview. I was actually impressed with how well laid out and scheduled it was. 
Then nothing. Nothing. 
I interviewed in April, did several follow up emails over the next months, but not even HR who had done my initial screening would return my email. Finally got a reply that "next week we'll know and contact you" after 8 weeks had passed. It's now the end of July and still haven't heard anything. Rude and unprofessional. I finally wrote and asked to have my application withdrawn.
Interview Questions: Asked if I might be the hire that would be the very best on their staff.

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Milwaukee, WI) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: great talked about experience and time I could start and what positions I wanted. Talked about what I would like to do and hours and year round employment.  Good interview.
Interview Questions: experience

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Online application > phone interview > in person interview with both my direct supervisor and then another interview with other lab members. From the date that I submitted my application to when I was hired was probably 3 weeks total.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I interviewed for the Department of Pathology. They were very nice and made you feel comfortable through the entire process. They asked around 20 questions, from basic to more specific to the job description. Both interviewers seemed down to earth and were straight forward with their expectations for the position.  
The salary is up for negotiation. Declined offer because of better offer from another Department.
Interview Questions: How do you keep yourself organized?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (New York, NY) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview, called in and asked about my research experience. Asked me a  few things why I changed my major and where I hear about the position. Asked me a question about stochastic differential equation.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose our track?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Initially was provided a phone call to confirm whether I was still interested. After a date was made have an in-person interview, I was questioned on my ability to thrive in a "wet" environment. Asked questions about relevant classes and commitment.
Interview Questions: Are you able to commit at least 12 hours to this lab?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was a skype interview on what I have done and what I would like to do in the future along with more research specific questions. It was an academic interview.
Interview Questions: research specific

title: Student Technician Interview

Interview Descriptions: Apply online, process takes ~1 week. Interview in-person. Interviewer was nice and made me feel comfortable. Hiring process took about 1 week, could be a little disorganized since the Library has a large number of employees and student employees.

title: Patient Service Specialist Interview

Interview Descriptions: Online Application, Online Questionnaire, Interview with two managers taking turns asking the questions. They gave me a copy of all the questions that would be asked as well, right before the interview. They were your typical interview questions about strengths, weaknesses, working on a team, working without direct supervision and the like.
Interview Questions: How would you prioritize a to do list that is seemingly impossible, especially working part time.

title: Part Time Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very casual. I applied online and reached out to the contact to ensure my interest in the position. I was then invited for an in-person interview. The interview was very casual. It was mainly just a quick introduction to myself and why I want the position. Overall good experience!
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (New York, NY) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I hard Just one interview, after the interview I waited for about one mouth for the results to be our.  After which a congratulation email was send to me asking me if I will like to accept the positioning or not. After accepting the offer I was given 6 months internship.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with us

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: It was very straightforward and handled directly by the people I would be working with.  It was a casual interview that did not seem to have any particular structure.  I believe here the process is quite varied from department to department and even within departments.
Interview Questions: What experience did I have with database management and their specific program?

title: Clinical Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: An employee referred me and I was asked to submit my application online. The process took about 6 weeks and everyone was nice throughout. Was very informal and they just wanted to know my career plans and ability to secure grants
Interview Questions: What is your career plan

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: streamlined, not difficult to understand, communicate  throughout process, disability accomodations were offered up front, benefits were explained and the point of contact stayed in touch. the process took about six to eight weeks total due to some staffing changes but they responded to all calls whenever I left a voicemail
Interview Questions: Technical skills as well as administrative skills

title: Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview with three Research Coordinators, two Research Managers, a Regulatory Coordinator and the budget coordinator. Went for a little over an hour, with some hard questions and then some questions that anyone with a few years of work experience could handle.
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized? And how do you think you will stay organized supporting three Research Coordinators who are running collectively over thirty study's?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process was smooth and easy. I applied online. It took two weeks to hear back from HR to schedule a screening interview. I was called back for another interview a few days afterwards. Less than a week later I was contacted with an offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me of a time you made a decision that was unpopular and explain how you handled it.

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very welcoming and warm environment. Went through three stages of interviews including phone, in person, and three group interviews. It was very professional process and I felt at ease the entire time.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: there was just one phone interview and asked about stupid linked list question. It wasn't bad or good. It was ok. Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Dec 2016

Everyone I had encountered was easy to talk to and it felt natural. They asked questions you would expect and mainly was looking for how prepared you are going into the interview.

title: Media Maintenance Technician III Interview

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: The process was smooth with all except one person in the school of medicine dept. I actually ended up declining the offer for employment vrcause I felt that there would be issues with the person. Even though she wasnt the direct hiring manager she made it vlear that she expected the position to be micro managed by her.

just behavior questions, talk like friend to see if communication skills, finally worked on a set of Math problems
just behavior questions, talk like friend to see if communication skills, finally worked on a set of Math problems

title: Unix Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had E-mail to verify my background and additional questions(like expect pay rate, why I want to get this job etc..), and first recruiter forwarded me to phone interview. title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2016

title: Fiscal Specialist II Interview

Interview Descriptions: I applied the job online about a month ago, and finally I got the chance to have an In-person interview. The interview went well and we spent almost an hour for the entire interview. There were two managers interviewed me at the same time, and each of them had their own job related questions for me. All the questions were standard questions like other companies, and only three questions required specific answers with couple examples.

title: Program Operations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington in Sept 2016

I could tell they had spend a lot of time looking over my resume because they specifically called out highlights they had seen or things they were interested in from my background, It was very easy and not intimidating. The interviewers were very engaging and went beyond the script of their questions to truly grasp who I was and what I could contribute to the position.

title: Education Training Specialist Interview

title: Fiscal Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions:
First: phone interview, second:in-person interviews; very basic and general questions one could expect. Basic knowledge of how the University operates under the federal and state rules.
Phone interview does not ask any technical questions.
Interview Questions: example of how detail-oriented you are.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I was not interviewed for this position. I applied using Husky Jobs, and got the job without so much as talking to anyone at HFS or Pagliacci Pizza. Odd way to do things, but I guess they trust their review criteria for resumes and such.
Interview Questions: I was not asked anything.

title: Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: You apply on the UW hires website. Monday, my status changed to "resume fwd to dept." Tuesday, I was emailed by the department asking for a phone interview. Wednesday, I had my phone interview and was immediately asked to come in the next day. Thursday, I had a 1 hour in person interview and was emailed immediately again. Friday, I had a short half hour peer interview. By Friday evening, I had a job offer.
Interview Questions: What is one thing that your previous supervisor would say is something you needed to work on?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: After I emailed my resume and cover letter, I got an email requesting a discussion over the phone. I was pretty much hired over the phone, because they just needed someone who can do the job and start ASAP.
Interview Questions: what experience do you have with consenting human subjects?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Had an initial 30 minute interview after which I was moved onto the second stage and had 2 interviews with senior program staff. The questions in the initial interview including a few standard ones, but also ones specific to the challenges of the position. Similarly, the second stage of interviews included standard questions but then specific questions related to knowledge of particular software applications.
Interview Questions: What interested you in this position/Why do you want to work for this department?

title: Front Desk, College of Engineering Deans Office Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for the position immediately I got an acceptance to the university of Washington. I love UW, and I wanted to be fully associated with it. Living at UW, studying at UW and working at UW was my goal. Wearing purple, too.
A day later, I got a email response on setting up an face to face interview. I was so excited, I forgot to ask crucial questions. I replied Yes to everything.

Interview Day: 
To realize my fear, I watched UW motivationals videos, and honestly I was very energetic.

The interview started awkwardly, I was to be interviewed by three people while I pictured only one person. It showed on my face and I thought to get it out of the way. 

"I am totally sorry, I should have asked for the number of people who would be interviewing me?" And all the awkward interview feeling vanished. My interviewers were amazing too!!
Interview Questions: Would you like to work with us in the summer?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Give a presentation for my phD  project and writing  the  grant application for possible job opening  .  It take at least three months before I know the result of my interview.
Interview Questions: Technical question  with my presentation and talk with all the member in the lab. Discussing the possible project  in future position

title: Health Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Bothell, WA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: You first do a big group interview where they observe you in a group setting. Your given various task and you work with your team to accomplish them. If you pass the group interview stage you are offered a 1 on 1 interview
Interview Questions: What does diversity mean to you?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I went through a phone interview, then was asked to come in for an in-person interview. There were five people in the room who went around, one-by-one, and asked me questions. They ended with letting me ask any questions that I had.
Interview Questions: What is a flaw you think you have in the work environment?

title: Traveling Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Group interview, no tough questions. Everything related to job experience. 
There were three interviewers each took turns asking questions.  Laid back setting but still professional. This was my first interview and experience with UW, and it was a positive one.
Interview Questions: What do you think will be most difficult about this job?

title: Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Bothell, WA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Standard interview questions for many advisory and/or customer service/support roles:

Tell us about yourself...Tell us a time you had an issue with a group member/colleague...Why do you want to work in this position...etc...etc...
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed about scheduling an interview within 2 weeks. The interview had 3 people from across the department I would be working with, each asking their own role specific questions.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you overcame a challenge.

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: I applied online which was nice. You need to give your GRE test scores, letters recommendation, an essay explaining why you want to get into Biostatistics and a transcript of your grades and classes taken. I know they really look at your letters of recommendation the most.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be in Biostatistics?

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process for this position is pretty simple. You send your resume to whatever recruiter is accepting applications at that time. From there, they will contact you via email and set up an interview with you. The interview is a group process. The recruitment panel starts by asking interview questions. During this part, I would encourage you to make sure your voice is heard without dominating the conversation (don't answer ever question). The are measuring how you work well with the team collectively. From there, the interviewers will administrate a case study. From there, it's the groups job to prioritize the importance and give a reasonable explanation of how you would handle the situation. Again, they are looking for how well you work with the team, but also your ability to articulste yourself. If you do well, the position should be yours.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a Student Ambassador?

title: Advancement Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Many, MANY interviews for a fairly low-rung job, but it's to be expected at a public university. It was clear that folks were not prepared for the interviews, and/or didn't really feel the need to exert too much effort. Maybe refining the process so only the input of those working most closely with the position is necessary would be helpful. Felt very much like a cog in a big machine.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with diverse groups of people?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2016
