Interview Descriptions: The interview was with HR and with the hiring physician, and was very relaxed yet focused on my skills and abilities. I felt the hiring team had a good insight into the daily responsibilities of the open position, and were able to answer all of my questions. Most of their questions for me dealt specifically with my experience and the open position, and were not "outcomes" or behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: To explain how I began working in clinical research, what my favorite and least favorite parts of the position were, and what my leadership skills and style was like.

title: Student Academic Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: online application huskyjob; followed by small talk from teaching and learning center, then a formal in-personal job interview and writing test. the staff are very friendly and you can reach out to anyone during the application process. you will need two recommendation letters from university of Washington faculty and a back ground check followed up by theh hire offer.
Interview Questions: walk through your resume, tell us about your working experience

title: Research Scientist/Engineer I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The professor contacted me via email and requested that I use an online survey to pick a day and hour when the interview would take place. She also requested a CV and list of references to be sent to her at least 24 hours before the interview. The interview took place over Skype. We talked over webcam about how much and what kind of lab experience I had. The conversation lasted about a half-hour.
Interview Questions: She asked me what interested me about the job.

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Washington in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was excited about this role and thought the interview process went very well. Following the final interview I was contacted by the hiring manager who told me that I was the committee's top choice and the most qualified, however the other candidate was just out of school and willing to take a lower salary. The manager stated that for my salary I had to commit to stay for several years (even though this was a temporary contract position). This whole interaction left a bad taste in my mouth so I walked away from the position. I didn't want to work for a manipulative manager.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a project you managed from start to finish that required data analysis.

title: Assistant Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: It was an in-person interview with both graduate advisor and undergraduate advisor present. The interview itself took less than an hour. I scheduled it over the phone with the undergraduate advisor herself, a week before the interview took place, and about a week after I submitted my resume.
Interview Questions: On a slow day, how would you keep yourself busy in the office?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: It involved a preliminary phone screen with the HR manager for the Law School, followed by an in person interview with 6 UW faculty and staff. Extremely uncoordinated and unfocused in nature.
Interview Questions: What is your background in academic program management?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Skype interviews available, as well as in-person interviews. Interview was expected to last 30 minutes based on initial comments during the interview, but ended up taking 50 minutes with long conversation. Initial small talk came across as part of the interview for collegiality.
Interview Questions: What kind of previous teaching experience do you have?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Just Question and answers. Talking about their research and how much they like it. I had a few questions in the back of my head for me to ask them about their research. Most of the time they get into what they do and don't stop talking.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join my lab

title: Student Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume to the manager and got an email ask me to go for an interview. It only take a couple of days. There were two managers doing the interview and the interview took only about 15 minutes.
Interview Questions: What's your leadership experience?

title: Real Estate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: I was one of many candidates to be selected for an interview and I was incredibly nervous. It was a panel interview with several key members of the office from multiple levels of the organization, including the executive team. They were thoroughly prepared, had a clear sense of the requirements of the job, asked good questions, good follow up questions, and were genuinely interested in learning as much as possible about me as a candidate in that brief time.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Clinicala Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Required both phone and in-person interview. They use interview teams that you meet with for this position. The phone interview is a screening interview prior to asking you to come in to meet with them. Had to do a presentation for the faculty. Takes several weeks, but worth going through the process.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this position. What do you bring to this position that others might not.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Talked with the instructor or Professor, who would ask some questions to make sure you understand the class contents. The the interviewer would ask the plan that you had for the course.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with the experiments/ Lab tutorials?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Had a brief phone discussion and scheduled a 1:1 interview for later in the week. That interview was very comfortable and carried on conversationally for an hour. Immediately was asked to return for a panel interview the next week. The panel was with 4 team members in similar roles and again was comfortable. Everyone was very friendly and responsive to my questions. I was told that the choice was between one other candidate and myself, and that I should expect to hear by the end of the day or early the following day. Never received a call, which I took to mean that the other individual was chosen. I was OK with that, but a call to let me know would have been considerate. This was actually the second time this had happened after an interview at UW Medicine within a month. Three trips there and time away from work, a simple call is the least they could do. Might make me think twice before even applying next time.
Interview Questions: All pretty standard.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: My interview was conducted out of formality. My employer had been extremely delighted with my resume and was ready to hire me the moment he saw me. It was really more of an introduction than an interview.
Interview Questions: My name? Things I did before that might be relevant to this project.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with the main administration people. Mainly behavioral questions, but punctuated with technical topics. Then I spoke with the other engineers and students to get a feel for the office and lab.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do after this position?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: A friend of mine referred me to an administrator who help me get a position as a student assistant. I was able to get the position within days. The interview process was very simple and straight forward.
Interview Questions: What's your schedule?

title: Budget Fiscal Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Nothing too interesting or different. Questions are common interview questions. It helps to know the department and its goal. These can be found on the website. First was a phone screening then a one-on-one with the division administrator, then a group with the people in your office. Overall an easy interview process.
Interview Questions: What is your weakness?

title: Career Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Had an initial Skype interview and then a second interview which was held on campus. There were 4 people on the committee for the initial Skype interview and second interview. During both interviews I was asked about 10 questions and during the second interview I was asked to present on an area of professional development for students.
Interview Questions:
What career counseling theory do I utilize most?
What experience do you have working with international students?
Lots of situational/behavioral questions

title: GBC Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Consisted of an application and in-person interview with GBC staff who was in charge of hiring. Interview consisted mainly of behavioral and skill based questions. About a thirty minute interview.
Interview Questions:
How do you manage your time? 
How would you prioritize multiple pressing project deadlines for different people in the office?

title: Graduate Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was relaxed and well thought of - the interviews were nice and personable and asked questions relevant to the job description only.
In addition to that, they asked a couple of management/ behavioral questions (what would you do in a particular situation?) basically just to see how well will you gel with the team.
Interview Questions: About my experience of using the relevant skills in my previous projects.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: You come in to one of their meeting rooms, they ask you to tell them about yourself, go over your resume, and why you want the job. It was pretty simple, as usually students apply. They're pretty lenient and don't have too ridiculous of expectations.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: An Advancement Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Submitted an online application and was contacted by HR within two weeks for a phone interview. The recruiter was pleasant, warm, and open, and the phone interview was very helpful for setting work/life balance and salary expectations and discussing the general responsibilities of the position, as well as getting a feel for how the department works. Someone from the department called later the same day to schedule two hours of in-person interviews the following week. I was told that there had been six candidates selected for phone interviews, two of whom were called back for in-person interviews.

The first hour of the in-person interviews was with a panel of half a dozen potential colleagues. Questions were reasonable and related to past experience, preferred work style/work space, management and conflict management styles, etc. All members of the panel seemed very willing to answer questions and share their experience with the University of Washington.

The second hour of the in-person interviews was with the position's direct supervisor and was not as positive. The supervisor seemed not to have read my application or know anything about my background, and was fairly uncommunicative for most of the interview. I left feeling like I would be a good fit with the rest of the team, but not with the position's supervisor. I was uncomfortable enough about the lack of fit with the supervisor to be very uncertain whether I would an accept an offer if one was made. The supervisor called three days later to tell me the other candidate had been hired, but wished me well. I appreciated the call and was relieved not to have to decline an offer.
Interview Questions: Take us through your professional background.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: The department contacted me directly for a phone interview, and I didn't have to deal with any HR drones. We had a couple phone interviews, then an in-person interview, then several more phone interviews. The process felt a little disorganized. At each interview, I was asked the same sort of basic questions: what experience do you have with ____? How do you handle stress? Towards the end, when I received/accepted the offer, the HR drones stepped in to handle the paperwork, and they seemed pretty overworked (lots of details overlooked).
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: PMa Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two part interview, one phone one in person. The interviewers were both very friendly and asked basic behavior questions. It seemed less about what you know but rather what kind of person you are and if you are suitable for the work environment.
Interview Questions: What is an experience you had difficulty with?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The whole process was very straightforward. The university has an abundance of research opportunities for undergraduates that have contact information. I sent an email to a lab I was interested in and they got back to me within a week to schedule an interview. It took place in the lab at the main campus in Seattle and consisted of behavioral questions, resume clarifications, and goals for the future.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you faced conflict in a project?

title: Senior Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: There are 2 rounds interview process for a research lab I applied. First it is with several lab co-workers with 5 back to back interviews. And then with the boss of the lab in person. The interview is smoothly organized with video, So you won't feel uncomfortable due to no yew contact. Not many technical questions most talking about behaviors.
Interview Questions: Why choose our lab

title: IT Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy and low stress. First I had a phone screen asking me about my past experience and general questions. After I was asked to come into the office and mostly repeated these questions along with general IT troubleshooting scenarios. I got a call the next day with an offer
Interview Questions: How would you troubleshoot a situation where a users screen only shows black?

title: Front Desk Host Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward and exactly what you would expect of any interview. I was interviewed by two managers who were both friendly and took turns asking questions. It took about 20 minutes and most of it was relaxed, get-to-know-you set up. I honestly think they just needed to make sure you were a normal person who could be trained.
Interview Questions: They did a couple scenario questions, "If a student is upset about a missing package how could you handle it?" One of the things they were concerned about is how you would deal with international students or someone who did not speak english well.

title: Learning Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview, then two in-person interviews. The second in-person interview had the higher-up bosses in the department. They did look at my LinkedIn profile as well as my resume. The questions were pretty standard.
Interview Questions: I don't remember specifically - they were mostly questions that pertained to my experience and how I could be an asset based on the posted job description.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Friendly environment throughout the entirety of the process. Employers are seeking energetic individuals. Two on one type interview. I was taken to commons area and asked about myself so mostly behavioral questions were asked. Took place at UW tower in the advancement department. Finance & Administration.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: first is to meet with the boss, and talk about myself and what the lab is doing, then gave a talk to the lab about my PhD work. After that, talk with different people in the lab to see what other people are doing.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you qualify for this job

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: 1 interview. 2 people at desk. Questions about personality and working style. Opportunity to ask lots of questions. People questioning were my manager-to-be and her manager. Easy questions with no right or wrong necessarily. Casual.
Interview Questions: How do you manage your time?

title: Web Media Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Hour long, reviewed past samples of media publishing as well as designed graphics. Went over resume to every detail and talked about other relevant positions. Also spoke about future plans and goals.
Interview Questions: What are your 3 strenghts

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Was with a professor for a research project. Incredibly easy interview (which I doubt is typical) - he literally just asked me if I had done research and if I could supervise people, to which I said 'yes.' That was essentially it.
Interview Questions: Have you supervised people?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Tacoma, WA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I started off with a phone interview with one of the directors of the department and the executive assistant of the vice chancellor. About three weeks later I had a face to face interview which lasted about 2 hours.
Interview Questions:
standard questions. 
Tell us about what you are looking for in an employer?
How do you handle feedback? (negative or positive)
How do you feel leading the student staff?
What are your strengths and weakness?
Where do you see yourself in 10 years?
Why did you pick this position and this department to apply for?

title: Editorial Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied at UW Press for editorial assistant. The interview process involved talking to about three different departments, All people in the departments attended. It sounds imposing, but actually the interviews were very casual and friendly. They were not highly organized and the expectations were about what one would expect from a job at a university press.
Interview Questions: What University of Washington books do you like and why?

title: Research Scientist Engineer I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Well, I was called I'm for an interview after I submitted my application on UW hires. I believed the interview went well and they promised to call me back in about a week but I never heard from them again.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little bit about yourself?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Facilitated via email and follow-up in person meetings. Discussed the laboratory set up and immediate goals of the lab. Discussion as to the role I would play as a postdoc and what the other lab members were going to be working on going forward.  Very congenial. Included tour of campus and the facility. Met with department members.
Interview Questions:
What are your ultimate career goals?
Why this position?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly straight forward. I met with the Principal Investigator of the Lab as well as a few of the lab members who were also working on the project. They were pleasant, asked and answered questions and were welcoming to be around. The interview was set-up through e-mail. There was nothing that stood out as unique about the interview process. It was held on campus.
Interview Questions: What got you interested in this position?

title: Legal Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a former research assistant. I was then interviewed by the project manager. She later confirmed with her superiors and sent me a written offer. The interviewer was very polite and kept in contact until she could send the written offer. Overall, it was very quick and easy.
Interview Questions: Describe your background

title: Advertising Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was very simple! Very casual and strictly only questions that were behavioral. The ad manager interviewing is an extremely nice individual who wants to get to know you. He is not trying to make you look stupid or put you in an awkward situation. Don't be surprised by the dirtiness of the office--you'll get used to it if you are hired!
Interview Questions: What do you consider is your biggest failure?

title: Imaging Research Lab Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: You get a phone call where one of the researchers tell you about the possible research opportunities that you can participate in. They also ask you about if you have prior any experience related to their research. Then there is an in person interview where they gauge your personality and interest in their research as they give you a tour of the facility,
Interview Questions: What prior experiences do you have with our research?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Takes a long time for the resume being forwarded to the department. We submitted it at the beginning of the year for one position, we didn't get contact until almost 4 months later. Once it's forwarded, very quick response. Another position I applied for I never got a response back, which is frustrating to wait.
Interview Questions: Situational and behavioral interview questions mostly.

title: Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview that lasted approximately thirty minutes. The interviewer explained the vacant position, asked relevant questions concerning my experience, and completed the interview. The phone interview was a good experience.
Interview Questions: What do you think of technology's role for society.

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Tacoma, WA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward interview with the Administrative Assistant Supervisor.  Applied online then was called in for an Interview.  A few days later, offered the position and started the week after. Overall it was a 2 week process, quick and easy.
Interview Questions: What did you do when you had to deal with an angry customer?

title: Quantitative Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Tacoma, WA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Once I got an interview I first took a test. It had mostly Math and Statistics questions, not just solutions but solutions with teaching annotations. Then during my in person interview we talked about my answers. I got one wrong, or maybe I got it right but it was extremely convoluted, anyway the Math Tutor solved it more simply. They don't want you to know everything, they mostly want you to have a good attitude when it comes to celebrating failure. That's what students Need.
Interview Questions: Standard Algebra, Geomerty, Trig, Calc, and Stats questions.

title: UW Summer Consulting Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral, Short case, three-person interview team. The interview was an hour long on-campus, very friendly staff so don't stress. They reviewed my resume as usual, talked about my work history, and asked what I was looking forward to when I begin working with new clients
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous consulting experience

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. The department required a resume and cover letter. Then I got an email to schedule the interview. The interview lasted about 30 minutes with my direct supervisor.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Relatively easy behavioral interview, no technical questions. Make sure to be very familiar with the professor's research and  ask questions about it. Called me in on-site and got back to me in a week or two. Basically have to show high interest and availability
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this lab/research, future goals, talk about your courses, etc.

title: Barista Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: The manager asked me questions about myself, prior work experience, words that describe myself, and provided me with a couple of scenarios that I had to answer on the spot.
Interview Questions: Words that describe my work ethic.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Walk you through the whole company, and gave detail introduction of the company, the current projects. Ask about each person's background information. Then you will be interviews by two people together. They first go over your resume, ask you some questions about background and your project, then came to the questions, all questions are simple and come from leetcode.
Interview Questions: find  a missing number from an array

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Pretty casual interview with recruiter (30-45mins) and then with manager (30-45mins). Both very friendly which made the atmosphere less nerve-wracking. Questions were very straightforward and open-ended. The whole process up to hiring took less than a week.
Interview Questions: What does it mean to be an UW employee?

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions:
First step was to answer essay questions given online. 
Second step was a group interview where 30 students in groups of four interacted and where judged by staff.
Third step was individual normal interview with staff.
Interview Questions:
What are your goals as a student?
Lots of situational questions..

title: Advancement Services Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: (I have not finished interview process). I was first contacted by the HR department for a 30 phone interview. Several days later, I was contacted by a member of the office that the position was in to set up an in-person interview the following week. The in-person interview is scheduled to last 2 hours: the first hour is with the entire team (excluding the main manager) and the second hour is with the director of the unit.
Interview Questions: Give an example of how you fostered a relationship in your previous work experiences.

title: Assistant to the Chair Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Beginning with UW temp services is a great way to go to get your foot in the door. If you have the skills, they have the jobs. I was recruited into the position from a temp job, asked to apply for the permanent position. I was able to negotiate salary and came out very well. Be prepared to answer behavioral questions and give examples of what you did and the outcome you received.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your previous position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: They recruit individuals quarterly and they look into how much time one can bring to the table. A good resume from high school with actual work experience is not enough to secure this job.
Interview Questions: What courses are you currently taking and how much time can you expect to commit on a weekly basis?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Washington in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: After submitting the PhD application package, you will receive the interview invitation. The interview is usually a 45-60 minutes Skype interview with 2 or 3 professors. You will discuss your research interest and research background to convince them that your are qualified and are ready for the research position.
Interview Questions: What is the research topics you will focus?

title: IT ASSISTANT Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was preferred by a previous employee. The manager basically knew about me before we actually met because of the introduction from the previous employee. The interview is at a cafeteria in the same building where I work. We spent most of time talking about my previous experience and projects. He also asked me question about my preferred work environment to make sure that I will fit with the current employess
Interview Questions: My previous experience and project? Preferred work place culture?

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: They were specifically looking for a someone with a solid skill set; someone who can bring real experience to the classroom. the interviewing process was easier for me as I graduated from the same dept., and had worked with many of the people on the team.
Interview Questions: What is your skill set and how can you apply it to this setting?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions:
I went for an in-person interview (no phone screen) right away. I met with the following people individually, each for a half hour, one right after the other:
1. Program Manager (would be my direct boss)
2. Program Administrator
3. HR Specialist
4. Program Director
5. Group interview with 4 future colleagues

Within a few days, the Program Manager called for references. A day after she talked with my last reference, I was offered the job.
Interview Questions:
-Have you ever had conflict with a coworker? How did you resolve it?
-Name your best quality.
-Name your worst quality.
-What project are you most proud of and why?
-Why are you interested in this position?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews one with staff I would work with, the second with faculty. I felt comfortable the entire time but the second interview felt more relaxed almost as if it was just a meet and greet. Half of the time we just discussed things about ourselves not necessarily job related questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you had to plan an event from start to finish

title: Research Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Nashville, TN) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Conference call with the current research directors at Vanderbilt Education concern. I found out about this opportunity from the primary investigator at my current research project job. The interviewees started by discussing what their roles were and why they had decided to move on to different roles in the organization or to other careers.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your qualities that would position you to fulfill this job?

title: Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Because nepotism at UW rules, I was asked two questions and then told I would be given any job that I wanted. I met with a senior person at the institution, dressed up, and had prepared extensively, hoping I would be grilled about my fundraising track record and ability to close gifts. Apparently, all that matters at UW is having the right friends. I was literally given my job. I did not have to earn it, persuade anyone of my value, or really interview for it.
Interview Questions: What kind of car do you drive?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I found the job through husky jobs and was contacted by email to set up a phone interview followed by an in person interview. I was asked personality and work ethic type questions. I was also asked to describe my overall work experience and extracurriculars. Overall, the interview was pretty easy.
Interview Questions: How would your friends describe you?

title: Statistics Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: CLUE is the UW's free, late-night, multidisciplinary study center located in Mary Gates Hall. I am a  UW student when I applied for this part-time on-campus job. I applied on line and got an interview 2 weeks later. There are two interviewers, one is the manager of CLUE and the other one is a Statistics Tutor working at CLUE. This interview can be divided into 3 parts. First part is behavior and fit questions and there are about 15 questions there. Secondly, they give me three statistics questions and ask me teach and explain these questions to them as if they were the students with questions to ask. Finally, they give me a statistics quiz with 6 questions. I was asked to finish this quiz by myself and hand in it to the manager before I leave. It took me about 40 mins to finish this quiz.
Interview Questions: What will you do if students only want you to give them answers and didn't pay any attention to your explain?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Tacoma, WA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two on one the first time around; 5 on one the second round to reapply for the position for the next academic school year of work study. You must turn in a resume and cover letter directly to the department you are applying to that has a specific position opening.
Interview Questions: What are you passionate about?

title: Graduate Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was notified in class that there was an opportunity to be a research assistant with a assistant professor researching for a well-known engineering company. I had a meeting with two professors and a professional engineer with a brief summary of the scope of the research project. I briefly described my background and I was hired later on! It was not an intimidating process.
Interview Questions: What was my engineering background and if I have any knowledge specific to the research project.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with the head of the lab via phone conversation.  Then, was asked if I'd like to apply for my own funding (fellowship) in order for them to afford me.  After receiving the funding I was asked to join the lab.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview with group of scientists and most questions about work experience and skills. They mentioned about ongoing and future projects. It lasted approximately 2 hours and I got an offer after 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Projects which I was involved in

title: Learning and Communication Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (New York, NY) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Remote hiring process involved introductory call, follow up via email for supporting media and panel video call with hiring committee. The ability to interview remotely was readily considered and made the viability of this interview process much greater.
Interview Questions: Describe a scenario where you had to manage conflicting obligations.

title: Research Scientist III Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions:
Found this job through a person in common working there before. 
I had the experience to this job but it was much more simple of what I was doing before. It took me months to decide and take the job since I was trying to find a better option. Times are difficult and I had to take it or live on unemployment...
Several meetings with the boss until deciding to take the job
Interview Questions: do you want this job? (it was a little bit down sizing to my expertise)

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied through UW website and got a call for in-person interview.  There were five people interviewing me.  No technical question, only behavioral questions.  They asked what is your strength, weakness, why should they hire you. Three out of five interviewers were friendly.  There were two who just listen, never smile, never nod along and ask you difficult questions.  I guess they are the ones who make the hiring decision. The whole interview took about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflicts?

title: International Studies Processing Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Application: I applied online through the UW Hires website, immediately after which I received a confirmation email. However, it was over a month by the time I received a call to schedule an interview.

Interview: The interview was standard, they gave me a tour of the workspace, pointing out the various library stacks that I would work with and explained the expected responsibilities in great detail. They asked me to tell them about myself, and my past work experience and asked for specific examples in which I solved problems and overcame challenges.
Interview Questions: After an hour long interview they tested me on my transliteration skills.

title: IT Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about my experience with developing web sites in the past and if I'd be able to work by myself on building future web sites for a small department at the University of Washington. I showed them some of my prior work and expressed confidence in my ability to assist them with their needs and they hired me on the spot. The process was very informal.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with content management systems before?

title: Senior Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online. The process took 8 weeks – interviewed at University of Washington.

Round 1 of interviews started 7:30am ended 8:30pm, included breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

Met with 24 people from the school of interest, including Dean, faculty, and staff; Conducted 30 minute lecturer


Point of first interview to actual hiring is between approximately 12 weeks.

Nothing difficult really. General questions to get a feel of candidate fit for the culture, specific questions to gauge subject matter knowledge, 30-minute lecturer to evaluate classroom presence.
Interview Questions: What will help me succeed as a faculty member?

title: Social Work Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was coordinated by the liaison. It was relatively straight forward. Was difficult to get a quick response from the contracted placement. To clarify, I was being interviewed for a placement outside of the school once I was accepted into the social work graduate program. The staff was incredibly nice and easy to work with. You have to advocate for yourself immensely as some placements are not the right fit.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a social worker? In what field?

title: Research Assistant/Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was a three person panel. The panel consisted of the key researcher for the project and two PhD students. It was quite relaxed and lasted about forty minutes.
Interview Questions: If repeating the same task would prove boring

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I got an interview call within a day i applied for the job. I had an in person interview with the professor.  He  asked me few data structure's and algorithm questions and some on test automation
Interview Questions: 1. Clone a binary tree.

title: Student Assistant, HFS Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: No interview required. After you submitted application, you will be notified about the job. And then there will be some training sessions to attend. After all necessary training, you will start to work.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Technology Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Saw the listing on Huskyjobs. Only required resume but was followed up with an email for website samples to look at coding experience. Scheduled for a interview with the supervisor and assistant that I was replacing (since she was graduating). The interview lasted no more than half an hour and was very casual.
Interview Questions: Asked about experience explaining complicated technologies to not so technical savvie faculty & staff (some of which have English as their 2nd language)

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: straightforward, the process was very informal. The interviewer was reading from a preassembled questions. Typical questions. interview was with the assistant nurse manager so it I had to very detailed, articulate  and precise so she can relay this to her boss.
Interview Questions: Describe a characteristics about you that you don't see but others do. Why is this ? And how do you bring it your advantage.

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Relative easy behavioral-based questions. A lot of questions were based and rooted in scenarios (i.e. what would you if...). These were relatively easy. Another point that they brought up and should be taken into serious consideration is the "monotonous work" which is very very true. After that it was a brief "get-to-know-you" questions.
Interview Questions: You handle extremely confidential personnel information. Have you had any experiences like this before in the past?

title: Research Scientist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: One on two meeting with the P.I. and their collaborator. Met at a roundtable in an informal setting and basically had a conversation with the two of them about my experience.
Interview Questions: What is an example of a problem you've encountered in your research and how you addressed it?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I went through two phone interviews and an in-person interview with over 10 people. The in-person interview lasted for about 1 1/2 hours. In retrospect, it was probably good to interview with that many people as I have worked on many projects.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: professor-interview over Skype, where the professor asked about how I view his research and what I would like to do in future projects. Also asked about was the previous research experience.
Interview Questions: techniques used in prior research and techniques expected in future projects

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard interview questions. First was a phone screen, and then a couple days later an email for an invite to an in person interview. The in person lasted two hours, with the first hour being with three people in the office, then a couple one on one interviews. The questions were clear and nothing to throw you off.
Interview Questions: None. They had a sheet with general questions about experience and scenarios you have either had or will probably need to deal with.

title: CLUE Tutor--physics Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: After submitting a resume and cover letter, qualified applicants are contacted for an in-person interview. The 90-minute interview process has two stages. The first is a skills test, with which the prospective tutor demonstrates their ability to answer, or at least try to elucidate, physics questions that would typically be asked during a drop-in tutoring session. The second is a panel interview, with the current lead tutor (and incoming, if any), assistant director of ASP, and possibly the director. The panel interview has a typical interview portion ("describe a conflict you overcame..." etc), and a role-playing portion.
Interview Questions: The most interesting question I was asked during my own interview was about how to handle a student who regularly used profanity, violent language, and raised their voice when speaking to tutors. I gathered that this was not abstract, but an actual problem presented by a regular student. (Though, mercifully, this is not a typical problem at this tutoring center.)

title: MA III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Saint Louis, MO) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
From the time I submitted my resume  to a face to face interview was about 3 weeks. I proceeded with a courtesy thank you e-mail and received a response for a group interview (2 weeks later) and was told they would get back with me. I have yet to hear back. This was a 6 week process. I then received a call from the HR department wanting to forward my resume to another department, I told her that I was still waiting to hear from the previous department. She was going to contact them to see if I was a candidate & get back with me.Still waiting (3 months) & this morning I reviewed a pre employment questionare, followed by a personal email from a college at a different department offering to accept my resume. 
The Process Takes Too long
Interview Questions: Are you the kind of person that if you have a case load and another coworker has a heavier load would you help them ? ?

title: Part Time Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online via the standard UW Jobs page.  Several weeks went by and I still had not heard back.  I proceeded to contact the Department Chair directly, stating that I had applied a few weeks prior and was sincerely interested in the position.  I immediately received a reply and an offer to come in for an interview.

I met with the Department Chair in person at the school for a formal interview.  Great personal touch and genuine atmosphere, very welcoming.  Questions were mostly about prior teaching and research, with the focus of our interview course content and course schedule.
Interview Questions: What type of online content management system experience do you have?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met individually with members of the group.  Some described their work and answered my questions.  Some asked me questions to assess my character, interests, and skills.  They were  respectful and quick.
Interview Questions: About my past projects, and if their projects interested me.

title: Web Computing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a friend and current employee who gave me a tour and then had me meet her boss. Her boss referred me to the IT manager and we casually conversed about my skills and future goals. They needed to fill the position quickly and didn't have too many other candidates.
Interview Questions:
How familiar are you with IT related work?
Why study engineering?

title: Research Study Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Approximately five minutes into the interview, the interviewer suggested that the department might not fill the position, but they had another position. The original position was posted because the current research study coordinator was on medical leave. Unless this employee returned before their deadline, the position would be open.  Evidently, the interviewer expected the employee to return. Then the interviewer began to discuss the second position, which was administrative with no research related responsibilities.
Interview Questions: Would you be interested in a new position that we are, or may be developing?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for the position online, at which point my resume was forwarded to the department and then I was contacted for an interview via email. I was not given an email update when my resume status changed, though it was updated on the UW job website.

The interview itself wasn't bad, though I was underqualified for the position and it showed. I found the interview panel (three people) to be professional and friendly. The questions were mostly related to the job, but they also tried to get to know me as well. It was a pleasant experience even though I didn't get an offer.
Interview Questions: How will you handle working with and assisting people who have more experience than you?

title: GIS Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Two 5-on-1 interviews.
Interview Questions: What new programs would you like to develop?

title: Change Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied through a connection over email; followed up with a formal electronic application on their hiring portal; a few days later, was contacted for a phone interview; offered a position the next day (the process was fast-tracked due to a critical need to fill the role)
Interview Questions: General questions about professional experience and potential application to their organization

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: First was asked to write a research plan; Then, I was asked to hold a seminar and present my research work. The whole process was almost 1 month. I was asked a few questions during the interview. They were pretty easy considering my research experience.
Interview Questions: What was your motivation to apply this job

title: CLUE Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my transcript along with my resume and cover letter. The program director sent me an email to schedule an interview. The interview is 2 hours and has 2 parts to it. For the first hour, there will be 3 people interviewing you, and you will also be asked to do a mock tutoring session. The second hour/45 minutes, you will be doing a test to test your knowledge about the subject.
Interview Questions: What would you do if the student tells you that his/her professor used a different approach to solve this problem?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was completely casual. As long as you express a genuine interest and show that you are competent at keeping things clean and organized, you are golden. I think the only question that was even asked was what your long term academic goals were and why you wanted to work there.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working in this lab?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied via HuskyJobs and had an got an email for an interview for the next week. After having an interview. I waited for about 2 months to hear back. Which is a long time in my opinion. But overall, it was an easy interview process and there is only one round of interview.
Interview Questions: What is your strength

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for a national search lecturer is long, cumbersome and unclear.  They select candidates. The candidates teach a sample class, either pre-existing or special lecture.  The hiring committee may or may not know anything about lecturing. The lecturer can also deliver a talk, but that's not always a possibility although all the faculty know about that. So there's very little chance to play to your own strengths.
Interview Questions: There are no real interview questions.

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I read several papers to prepare for the interview and then we I discussed them with the PI so he could grasp my understanding of them.  We spent about 3 hours discussion the papers and the research project I would be working on.
Interview Questions: To come up with a future experiment for the project I would be working on.

title: Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions:
normal and straight to the point , clear and concise. Not stressful at all The board  began by asking you a series of questions to assess your knowledge, abilities and personal suitability. These  include:

Closed questions that demonstrate your knowledge by requiring a specific factual answer.
Open-ended questions that are broader in scope and require you to work through the answer.
Situational questions that describe a hypothetical situation and ask how you would proceed in those circumstances.
Behavioural questions that ask you to describe a time in your own history when you dealt with a certain situation, and to explain how you dealt with it.
You may also participate in a set of exercises that will demonstrate your abilities and suitability for the role. (All candidates for the same role will go through the same testing process.) These may include:

Tests that demonstrate your ability or knowledge of specific relevant tasks, such as keyboarding, accounting principles or writing a memorandum. These may be written or performance-based tests.
Situational exercises that use hypothetical situations to demonstrate your ability to solve problems or make decisions.
When the questioning and testing phases of the interview are over, go ahead and ask any questions you still have about the position, the selection process or any other aspect of working for the Yukon public service.
Interview Questions: why do you want to be a mentor?

title: Assistant Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: pannel interview and one-on-one with the Associate Vice President of Advancement
Interview Questions: explain your resume in a story

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Will suggest to contact the professor directly to discuss the potential research project. Also contact her/his current graduate student will be extremely helpful given that professor are usually very busy to reply the emails.
Interview Questions: No tricky question. Make sure you emphasize your research interest.

title: Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Fun online application, phone screen, in person, panel interview. Toured office, met team, went out to
Lunch. This is too man words I’m
Just here so I don’t get fined. Still not enough words.
Interview Questions: What is ARP

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Applied through Huskyjobs (university job website) and got called for an interview few days later. Then whole process took less than a month.
Interview Questions: Easy behavioral questions

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: You pretty much have to know someone to get an interview/job in the UW system. Although i know this is the case with most jobs. I first had an interview with three department administrators followed by two phone interviews. It was all the "typical" interview questions,..strengths and weaknesses, how to deal with a difficult situation, how to deal with competing program needs...nothing unexpected.
Interview Questions: Nothing out of the ordinary in regard to "typical" interview questions.

title: Data Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was first a phone screening and then an in person interview.  Enjoyable process.  Questions were reasonable and they really seemed to want to find a good fit for both the employee and employer.
Interview Questions: No trick questions here - just good old fashioned "tell me about a time when..." types of scenarios.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Hired on second interview
Interview Questions: Name a time you failed with a student and what did you learn?

title: Research Scientist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with PI, then a face to face with PI and lead research scientist.
Interview Questions: No behavioral question, only interest and prior experience.

title: Program Operations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Online application and email communication for the most part - lovely! Interview process is different dept to dept, tho a creeping trend of "have to ask every single applicant the exact same questions" has appeared and makes interviewing there rather awkward for both sides.
Interview Questions: Unexpected - asking about chemistry in a computer support position interview. Supporting social science faculty.

title: Computer Lab Assistant and Network Management Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions:
I have to submit my resume and wait for my manager to call me for interview. 
he interview in person with some computer system related questions.
Interview Questions: no, most of questions is about computer system and network system which I have already learned at school.

title: Mechanical Engineering Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: I was not interviewed for this position. What ended up happening was me going to Professor and asking whether he had any current projects available. He looked at my excellent grades then had me work for free for a quarter (3 months) then I was paid for the next quarters. However, my adviser kept telling me that I should have insisted on getting paid for the first quarter as well. So if you are smart and talented (not necessarily in the research area, does not matter) be sure to know your value and don't settle for just anything. There are many willing grad students for research assistantships but not very many that are bright, i.e., can think out of the box.
Interview Questions: The difficulty came in when I did not stand my ground on getting paid right away.

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Email reply was timely, two person interview, typical questions, some explanations need to be overly detailed or you may be called out for it, not much else to say, it was as expected really; no weird leadership abstract thinking on your feet questions out of the blue
Interview Questions: What is your experience with technology?

title: Fiscal Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Began by applying in the Washington.edu website. Applied on there. Received a phone interview. Got asked to come in for an in person interview. Got the call a week later saying I received the job. There is room for negotiation in salary so keep that in mind.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the University?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online Aug 1, 2013.  First contact was Aug 27th boilerplate email, "Dear Candidate...we're conducting 15 minute phone interviews over the next 3 days, if you are interested in pursuing this opportunity, please choose a time from one of the following 4 hour blocks and we will call you. 15 minute phone interview on was with the Administrator of the department, mostly feeling me out about the (low) pay range. An email followed that day requesting an in person interview the following week.  

Parking is challenging, get a ride if possible.  Interview was approximately 1.5 hours long with 3 people, the Administrator I'd been emailing/speaking with previously, and 2 Department Heads. Questions were very standard, read from an HR form, "Describe a time when you faced a conflict with a coworker and how you handled it", "If you were given an assignment and a deadline that you found was impossible to meet...", etc.  

Overall it seemed to go very well.  Both Department heads seemed very interested and impressed.  Administrator was quiet.   

Got a form email on 9/25/13 that another candidate had been chosen. 

(The position had been eliminated a year previously due to budget cuts.  It felt as though I may have been one of several required competitive candidates, so they could bring back the person who'd previously held the position. But this is only a guess.)
Interview Questions: No unexpected or difficult questions.

title: Manager of Program Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Little was asked prior to the meeting.  It was clear the interview was a sham as nothing of substance was asked.  While my resume and cover letter made it clear I was completely qualified for the position, I was not included in the last stage of interviews.  Ultimately they placed someone with no qualifications in the position.
Interview Questions: Unrealistic hypothetical questions were proffered which were not germane to the position or its expected function.

title: Part-Time Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: My advisor introduced me this job. They just asked me which courses I would like to teach. Need to mark the homework in sure. Handling students for me is the most challenging. It is good that I don't need to back to UW every day. I share a office with another.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: intervied in a small room, the guy read questions off a paper, about 6 then picked a few more from another sheet; he seemed nice and said that he would have to check with the managers who were hiring. i got the impression i was going to get hired, but then got the rejection email
Interview Questions: all said on this site

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Group Interview with multiple people
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult coworkers

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: I found my job on naturejobs. I e-mailed an application and had one phone interview. After the phone interview all correspondence was through e-mail. Upon arrival and the workplace I was asked to give a presentation to the lab on my previous research. I was already hired so this was informal. I have since learned that this occurs before hiring in most cases.
Interview Questions: None, the interview was very straight forward. I was asked about my past research and lab experience.

title: Counseling Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, followed by in-person interview. FYI UW has a really slow HR system and it took a long time for the department to receive my resume, which I found out after I was hired.
Interview Questions: We had more of a conversation about our working styles and what was going on with the department, rather than a formal interview.

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I found the ad through my PI's website. I sent an email inquiring about the position and was asked to submit my CV in return.  It was only a few days after that I was asked to have a brief phone interview where I was asked a few questions about my background and skills.  Nothing too difficult and everyone was pleasant.
Interview Questions: Probably the most challenging was whether I planned to stay in academia.  Because I am not entirely sure if I do, I didn't want it to affect my chances for the job.

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was very informal. I applied online, submitted my resume, answered a few online behavioral questions, my GPA in class for CSE 142/143. They then contacted me for in person interviews with the head TAs, where they asked me to display my teaching style. That's it!
Interview Questions: asked me to display my teaching style. That's it!

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Had to complete a skills test on math concepts from precalculus to matrix algebra followed by personal interview with managers.
Interview Questions: Number of odd numbers from 1 to 1000. Discrete math.

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online about 30 days later I had a phone interview.  2 days after that I was called back for an in person panel interview.  HR, director of a co-team and finance manager.  Then 3 days later I was called for second in person interview.  3 doctors I would be working with.  Then about another week later I was called for my third and final interview with the interim director.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the UW?

title: Part-Time Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Tacoma, WA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Initial contact with administration to determine best fit position on campus. Pre interview with Program Director who explained the position. Then, group interview with who would become my full time faculty mentor and the program coordinator. Discussed the position in more detail and my qualifications. Progressed to brainstorming how the first project should be completed and how I could impact the new program.
Interview Questions: What is your view on teaching diverse students?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Once your resume is accepted you interview directly with who is going to hire you. The process is highly variable depending on where you apply since the University is so large. However, the interview process is probably more casual than any comparable industry.
Interview Questions: Basic science questions.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Meeting with multiple lab PI's; going to talks and posters; interacting with current students
Interview Questions: Everyone is nice

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was quick and easy. They asked me why I want to work there, how I would contribute to the library's office, they asked me to tell few things about myself, asked for my background, if I had any experience etc.
Interview Questions: There wasn't one.

title: Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: This was quite a few years ago, but  the whole hiring and interview process took a long time to go through interview and lots of technical questions.  Also had to interview with many different departments at different sessions.  The hiring process could have been much simpler if they had less parties involved.
Interview Questions: Lots of technical questions

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2013
