Interview Descriptions: There is a group interview. There is a multitude of tasks you do with the group to ensure you know how to work in a team. I suggest not talking too much so you don't dominate the activity. If you make it, then you move into the final interview where you sit professional staff and they ask you behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a student did not want to be at orientation?

title: Technical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Washington
Interview Descriptions: Applied through HuskyJobs. Had two interviews: the first one is a phone interview. Not too many surprises in this interview. Mostly the questions are based on my past experience in resume. The second interview is with two people, one is the manager, another is the technical lead. Then I was informed about the result in one week.
Interview Questions: How to deal with an angry customer.

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: This was an internal hiring opportunity. I was put up for the job, and had to go through an executive-level review. People were late (which is disrespectful). They assumed I'd take the position just because it was internally recommended. I wanted the opportunity, but they made no attempt to sell me on it. For an internal promotion opportunity, this process was exceedingly drawn out (90+ days). Once I accepted, they gave me three days to transition.
Interview Questions: What elements are part of a communications strategy.

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very standard. I was emailed to set up an interview time. Came to the office and the interviewer directed me to an empty office room for the interview. Asked basic questions like how to deal with angry customers, writing and typing abilities, and scheduling. After that the interviewer talked about the experience in working at an office environment and what is to be expected. Then asked if I had any questions. That was all there was to it. They hired me immediately after.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with an unpleasant customer?

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: One of the manager called for an in-person interview. On the interview day I met with two managers and they asked me a few easy questions. They asked what my goal was going to be and why I applied for this position. They were really nice and it was a causal interview. They also told me it was ok to have informal dressing.
Interview Questions: What did you do in your previous employment?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was relaxed and very informal. There were no set questions presented in a typical interview setting. Asked to talk about oneself and then expand on some ideas presented.
Interview Questions: The lack of a traditional interview.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: apply based on internal referal
Interview Questions: nothing unexpected, show your background and skills in the position you apply

title: Behavioral Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: I feel really lucky that I didn't have to do a formal interview. I was working a behavioral coder for class credit and from there I was sought out for employment opportunities. The interview I had initially as a student was brief. The graduate student in charge of the study asked me why I was interested in the position and what experience I had with behavioral coding. I told her I had none and she said it was ok because I would be trained in a specific type of coding.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this project? (It was a study on Autism)

title: Research Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Had a one-on-one interview for a research tech position in a biomedical research lab. Interview was the P.I. asking about my previous research experience, quizzing my knowledge on various experimental techniques, and inquiring about previous academic coursework, the latter of which was difficult to recall as several of the courses had been taken several years ago.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Scientist IV Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Because of the nature of academic research, the interview process was somewhat informal.  I was asked for my qualifications, resume and so forth.  However, a formal interview came with the director of the lab I wanted to work for and an informal conversation with the corresponding department administration that the lab was a part of.
Interview Questions: What were my exact skill sets for the particular type of experiments they wanted me to pursue, or research?

title: Senior Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Email contact and got a face-to-face interview directly. The PI was very nice, asked a couple of questions, I gave a presentation to the whole group and a few days later offer was made.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research in graduate school

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: through at least three rounds interview, online interview , talking with HR, and personal interview with lab members, gave a presentation talking about your previous work and your future plans, and so on
Interview Questions: future plan for your career development

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by other faculty. This seems to be extremely common among universities. I met with the department head and a faculty member who is expert in the course subject. We discussed the subject and my research ideas. It was a very friendly atmosphere.
Interview Questions: What was my interest in teaching this course.

title: Fiscal Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: First interview held by 2 managers, small room. Somewhat organized and relaxed. 2nd interview held by six managers. All of us were seated at a round table, intimidating at first-but the interviewers made efforts to be friendly.
Interview Questions: 'What made you think you would be a good fit for this position?'  'Tell us about yourself.'

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Tacoma, WA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions:
For the hiring process first I had to write a quick one page essay to describe why I am suitable for this job.
Then the professor asked me some general questions about my interests, earlier projects and coursework.
Interview Questions: The unexpected part was to write an essay about why am I suitable for this job.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was flown over to Seattle and met with about 10 different laboratory personnel-we mostly just talked about their research and my research.  Very laid back.  I then presented my research at a lab meeting. I should probably state that my position was also contingent on my getting a postdoctoral fellowship before this process, which I did.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: It is just a teaching assistant position, I took that class, and received a good grade, so I emailed Professor for a TA position, he replied me after several days, and gave me the offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Resident Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Standard residential life interview process: phone interview, conference interviews, on campus interview (full day).  Met with a variety of residential life staff, students, and other administrators within the unit.  Long, but great day that was well organized, professional, and left me feeling like they knew what they were doing.  Solid communication throughout the process, everyone who I spoke with had nothing but great things to say about their experience working there.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in being an RD at UW?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was long and tedious. I didn't find out I had the job until August of the school year and took a job in the meantime oncampus, that I had to resign from.  Re-appointment was easy and guaranteed, as long as the student reviews we're fine.
Interview Questions: How you are qualified. What experience you have.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: There is a visit to the department sponsored by the department which you applied for after you got admitted. Then during the visit you got chance to talk to those professors you wish to work with.
Interview Questions: The areas you are interested in and the research experience you have in that particular area.

title: UW-IT Student Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: You apply online after looking at the online job board. You submit a cover letter and resume. They do not expect lots of experience, so focus on passion and leadership roles you have held in the past. After submitting, they will send you an email when they want to interview you.
Interview Questions: Do you prefer to work alone or with a team?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: They fly you in for recruitment. The interviews are mostly tame. They ask you about your research experience and why you want to come to UW. If you get the interview then you will get an offer unless you make a fool of yourself at one of the events.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research...

title: Operation Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: This is an interview for the operation internship for Goldman Sachs. It is a two-round interview. One round is half hour, so it was one-hour long in total.
Interview Questions: Given a scenario, say, you need do a presentation for your client. The presentation is supposed to last for at least 2 hours. But your clients have to rush to another meeting, so you only have 20min left to get this presentation done, so how can you deal with this situation?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough and reasonable with timing. Did not drag.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview process consisted of initial phone screen with hiring manager, followed by two, one-hour group panel interviews. Overall questions were relatively standard with the second group being the easier of the two.
Interview Questions: How do you handle working in a diverse environment. Not really difficult just unexpected.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by on campus interview. There were 3 total candidates.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself fitting here with regard to the mission of the University?

title: Technical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume to the department and was told to come in after a couple days. After a few general questions about attitude, I started.
Interview Questions: All questions just asked how comfortable I was working with people and my basic knowledge of using computers.

title: Audio Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Face to Face with manager of department.  Very cordial, very friendly.  Lasted about one half hour.
We spoke about each others experiences in the business.  From there I was introduced to an executive producer with whom I would directly work with.  The same process, where we spoke to each other about one another's experience level.
Interview Questions: With my level of experience, why was I applying to work at such a small facility.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was teaching out of my department so I had to contact the department I wanted to teach in. They were nearly at capacity but I was given an interview. The interview consisted of some common questions that are difficult if you don't have a thorough understanding of the subject matter. Then I was contacted two days before the term started because I was the last TA they were going to pick.
Interview Questions: It had to do with Newton's third law pairs, work, and something else that I forget.

title: Commercial Plumber Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: As I had worked in the Facility Services department previously, the interview and hiring process was minimal. The new area that I was working was organized by my previous supervisor. He was a big help in getting me in the door. He could vouch for my past role within the department.
Interview Questions: How long have you worked within the plumbing industry?

title: Assistant to the Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions:
10 minute phone interview. Took about 2-3 weeks to get called in for a panel interview after having asked for an update about my candidacy status. Panel interview consisted of 3 ppl. Some typical "what would you do if" questions along with questions related to the actual position.
Took another 3 weeks to get an answering concerning a second interview. First request for an update went ignored by HR even though I was told to contact them if I did not hear from them by the end of the week of the interview. I waited one more week to ask about the second interview again, which finally got a reply that I had not been chosen for a second interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the University of Washington?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview, followed by one in person interview before receiving offer.
Interview Questions: What is it about us that make you want to work here?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: The phone interview was very easy and conversational.  Mostly clarifying prior experience.  The in-person interviews consisted of multiple one-on-one interviews back to back.  Some of them were structured while others seemed to be just an open conversation.  The unstructured interviews were slightly uncomfortable since they apparently wanted me to lead the conversation and didn't ask more than a few questions.  The environment was fairly casual and relaxed.  After the initial interview it took about a week to hear back.  After the second round it took about two weeks, but they were good at communication and let me know about delays.  The office seemed great and everyone was very happy and friendly.
Interview Questions: While you don't probably know in-depth about our programs yet, from what you've gathered, what do you think is the most valuable to aspect is to students?

title: Research Scientist/Engineer I Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: The phone interview was friendly and very quick. I was asked a few questions about my experience and my future career goals for the next few years. I was told that 50+ people had applied for the job, and that 6 were getting phone interviews, and 2 from those were getting in person interviews. From our interactions, it seemed that the PI already had someone else in mind.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with mouse models?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: started as a grader, establish good connection, got offer without further interview
Interview Questions: no difficult question

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: visited website and found interesting project
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here?

title: Student Affairs Position Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Tacoma, WA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Through an employee referral, I applied online.  Within three weeks, I was invited for a 20-minute phone interview with a selection committee.  They asked a variety of questions, including but not limited to student development, event planning and diversity.  The following day I was invited for an on campus interview, which was planned two weeks later.  The on campus interview was a day long process, where I invited with different members of the campus community, individually or in groups.  However, I did not hear back regarding my candidacy following the interview.  I found out that the position was offered to another person online.  However, the campus is small but growing and has strong ties to the surrounding community.  Mostly everyone I interviewed with loved the work that they, which all was in support of the students.

Please know that I am a very mellow and calm yet collection kinda guy, but one interview, in particular, from my campus visit left a bad taste in my mouth.  It actually changed my mind about the position, and after walking away from that, I realized I didn't want to work for a senior level administrator, who was really aggressive, not welcoming, and too proud.  This is not a reflection of others.
Interview Questions: Please describe your diversity philosophy, and how you incorporate it into your work.

title: Research Scientist/Engineer Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the PI and lab manager as well as the researcher I would be working directly with.  It was a very low, key friendly experience. I was mostly asked questions that had me describe my work personality, problem solving skills, and past experiences.  There were any surprise or tough questions.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience working in a lab.

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied via UWHIRES, received a call from HR a few weeks later, and then another few weeks later one of the team members called me.  We scheduled the interview for 2 days later, and met one of the team members for 15 minutes.  After this 15 minute time period, I walked into a group panel of people.  I was asked to briefly describe my background, what interested me about the job, and where I saw myself in 5 years.  Then they took turns giving me background on the projects that they had going, and a few that they would like to see get off the ground.  I was called back to meet one person that had no made the group panel interview, and we met the following day.  The next Monday I believe, I received a call from the Hiring Manager, and was offered the job.  I had to wait to begin the job until my background check was cleared by the State of Washington, and then scheduled for my orientation and first day of work.
Interview Questions: What makes you as a candidate unique?  How would you describe your ideal job?

title: Web Design Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Applied through HuskyJobs (http://careers.washington.edu/HuskyJobs).

Had one phone interview with the hiring manager and then had a panel interview with the entire time to answer questions on my portfolio and resume.

A lot of questions were on my passion, what web design and coding work I've done before, what classes I took that is relevant to this position, and what I want to work on with the team.
Interview Questions: What do you think of jQuery?

title: Bioengineering Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: After a tough application including a CV, letter of statement, personal statement, and a regular online application, accompanied with GRE SCORES, TOEFL SCORES (international applicants), and several letters of recommendation (3), I was pre-selected to come to campus for an interview. They flew us to seattle around March to see the beautiful UW campus and meet some of the BIOE students and faculty. After that, we were told we were admitted to the program and offered a rotation possibility AND gave use the chance to meet with the faculty (if available) about the research they were doing.
Interview Questions: What is your vision 5 years from now, after you finish your PhD?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume and was called in for an interview. Answered the standard questions, and was called back for a second interview a few weeks later.  At the second interview I was asked more program specific questions, like how I would handle organizing multiple programs at once, and what experience I have dealing with students from other countries (the position was in an international programs department).
Interview Questions: How do you ensure accuracy in your work?

title: Lead Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Follow advice on website about how to format your resume to be scanned by UW system. Also, read job description carefully and make sure you have key words in that align your experience with the requirements of the job description. For example, I didn't think to include "familiar with Word" because I'm a writer who has used Word for years--didn't think to list it, though, and needed to. 

Bring a printed copy of your resume/CV to the interview, or a couple copies if you're being interviewed by a group. Research the people you will interview with and know the topic/job being advertised. Bring writing samples or samples of your past work.

UW is informal, but people are busy. Come prepared. Write a thank you note after you leave the interview and hand deliver it to the administrative assistant or put in mail room or mail that day. Spell people's names correctly.

A sense of humor is almost always welcome.
Interview Questions: Do we intimidate you?

title: Technical Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: Pleasant interviewers, 3 person panel.  Wanted to know about my passion for the mission, how my education had prepared me for the position, wanted real life examples whenever possible.  It was obvious that there was a definite need for the position to be filled, but an unwillingness to take just anyone.  The position had been offered to someone that had lied about their work experience on LinkedIn, that individuals offer was then rescinded.
Interview Questions: Following the interview I was asked to prepare a line item budget in Excel.

title: Project Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: Honestly, not too challenging; it was what I expected.  I interviewed with 2 research faculty and a clinical director.  They asked me what sort of experiences I had that were clinically challenging, what sort of research experiences, etc.  It also helped that I was familiar with the research group; it had a good reputation.
Interview Questions: What experience have I had with men with anger management issues and crisis issues.

title: Contact Center Candidate Bank Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: Standard interviewing process for state job
Interview Questions: None of the questions were difficult. Standard customer service questions

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: TPC from recruiter.  Scheduled interview with the manager and a few staff.  Did not hear back from manager that I didn't get the position.  Finally contacted the recruiter and was told I would not move further in the interview process.  Position was probably not a good fit for me.
Interview Questions: Questions were very straight forward.  They did not bring about difficult questions to answer.

title: Web Computing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very bureaucratic, disorganized. Sporadic communication. You're never quite sure who you're negotiating with and is making the decisions: someone behind the scenes in the central HR bureaucracy, the hiring manager/interviewer you're actually communicating with, or some other person/people in the hiring group. Overall there was a lack of knowledge of the technologies and skills they were interviewing for, and of current market salaries for them. Your mileage may vary. Everyone was very friendly, but very slow and tedious process.
Interview Questions: Did you have any trouble finding our office?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: On-site interview. Presented research. Interviewed at the presentation and also met with 3 faculty.
Interview Questions: No unexpected or difficult questions.

title: Research Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was promoted from within the institution, so there was a semi-formal interview process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was lengthy, consisting of several interviews with people throughout the department. I had an initial 1:1 interview with another individual at the same level as the job for which I was applying, and with the hiring manager. This was then followed by another group interview (logistically for the team a phone interview worked better), and then with individual faculty members, and finally with the director of the department. The department is vibrant and diverse with regard to background and expertise, and it is an intense workplace with high performance expected at all times.
Interview Questions: You're managing a project that requires several supplies to be shipped to multiple countries, and one of your country contacts is unable to get the supplies they need for the project in time. They have already hired everyone for the project and now there will be a 3 month delay. How do you handle that?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: My new manager had me pre-picked as the destined new hire for this position. She had hand selected me from my former position at the University of Washington and knew I was a faithful and reliable and smart worker. The interview was a formal process in order to get hired for the posted position.
Interview Questions: How have you helped  a struggling coworker incapable of doing their job?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: To get an interview at the Univ of Washington, an individual needs to submit an application for a specific position to the UW Human Resources Department.  The Department reviews the application to ensure it is appropriate for the position applied for.  If the applicant meets the job criteria, the application is rated by and HR person for appropriateness for the position applied for.  They select the top applications and forward them to the requesting supervisor.  The supervisor selects the candidates they wish to interview from those forwarded to them, and contacts the application.  An interview is set up.  The applicant may have to pass specific tests within each dept, depending upon the position.  The applicant gets an opportunity to ask any questions he or she may have.  The hiring person hires the candidate they think is the best for the position.  The candidate may leave their application on the HR site, and forward it to other open positions they are interested in, as these positions get posted.
Interview Questions: Do you have any qualms working in a Department which performs research on lab animals?

title: Research Scientist/Engineer III (Data Manager) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online, and received an email within two days.  I spoke briefly on the phone with the biostatistician who was reviewing resumes.  We went back and forth in email but I had a phone interview within a week (unusually fast for the University).  The phone interview consisted partly of a description of the research study whose data quality was being checked (QC was a big part of this job) and the reporting, analysis, etc. necessary.  The questions I answered had to do with why I was leaving my current position, what I had done with the relevant software (SAS), and so forth.  

The next step was a skills test - ten SAS programming problems.  Many were easy, some were at a fairly high skill level, but since I completed it on my own time, over a weekend, with full access to documentation, it was not a problem.  I also sent the biostatistician sample code and process documents.

Within a week I heard back and was invited for an in-person interview - but first, there was a lengthy email discussion about salary (since I was a current employee of the University, my salary was posted with other state employees, and he was able to determine I was earning much more than the position was budgeted for.  We were both still interested, so the in-person interview was scheduled.

I met with two other data managers (the position was advertised as "Data Manager" but the University classification was "Research Scientist/ Engineer III"), the biostatistician, and the principal investigator for the research project.   It was an illuminating discussion; by the end it was clear (to me, at least) that the job would be better filled by someone who had a few years of SAS under her/ his belt rather than someone with database / project management experience (who would probably rock the boat).  

I stayed at my current job.  All in all, the experience was very positive - lots of mutual respect even though the fit wasn't right.
Interview Questions: Would you be comfortable just being a programmer?

title: Web Computing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for an interview about two weeks after I submitted my resume. I was interviewed by three people at once. It was low-key and friendly.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Human Resources Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with HR representative, hiring manager, key department heads and finally the head of Department.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the department.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (University, WA) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: The U has an easy way about it with some emphasis on excellence in the interview process.  After hiring, this expectation was prevalent, in my experience, and somewhat debilitating in the long-term.  My experience told me, get better positions, higher positions.  And i finally went to school to specialize, I don't like offices.
Interview Questions: Because it was my first real job, "what is your experience", was most difficult to field.

title: Web Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: The process from the time I had my first phone screen to the time I was offered the job was quite fast. I think it was a total of 2-3 weeks, but my position was entry-level and only required one panel interview. I was brought in for a panel interview which was immediately followed by a one-on-one interview. I did a lot of listening during the process, which allowed me to pick up on personalities, management style (as much as possible, anyway) and the interaction among panelists. My main takeaway is to ask for a bathroom break during transitions!
Interview Questions: I don't recall an unexpected question, just an unexpected personality. The panelist joined in half-way through the interview (which was planned) and clearly wanted me to "talk shop". I put on my tech hat for the panelist for a couple answers. Otherwise the questions were your ordinary mix of experience and behavioral questions.

title: Senior Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: The research investigator invite me to Seattle, WA. I passed four days in Seattle. The interview day was very long, started 9:00 AM through 6:00 PM. I presented my thesis research and had interview with each laboratory member. I had lunch and dinner. The principal investigator paid for everything, ticket airplanes, hotel, food, and taxi.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Grants Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was an internal applicant, so it's possible that the interviewing process is more extensive for those who are not already UW employees. The interview itself was conducted by a small panel made up of one of the Associate Directors and two of the Grant Administrators who I would be working under. It lasted for an hour, with most of the questions focused on grant and contract knowledge, as well as knowledge of office procedures. Of particular benefit was an in-depth understanding of OMB Circulars and familiarity with NIH processes.
Interview Questions: When I interviewed there were no outlandish or unexpected questions. However, training into the position was not really an option. Applicants had to already have several years in grant management experience, including management of grants from federal agencies.

title: Research Scientist III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty relax for my unit.  Since the laboratory unit is small, everyone from the lab were involved in the process.  Their goal is to find a colleague that has the personality to match up with the rest of the people in the lab.  The hiring is based the vote from everyone.
Interview Questions: There wasn't too much technical questions for the position I was hiring for.  I think they generally looking for someone who's trainable instead of someone who's already trained

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Washington in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: we had a one-on-one interview at the conference room. The interviewer asks mostly about my background and personality. There were no behavioral questions. There were two rounds of the interviews in total. I think enthusiasm to get the job is the most important trait they are looking for.
Interview Questions: tell me your most proud-of experience in college

title: Help Desk Consultant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: A few people sit in during the interview process. Questions regarding your previous experience doing technical support and communication abilities definitely arise. They want to see if you can accommodate for a wide range of people who ask for help; be it students, staff, visiting professors, to people who are just visiting the public library.
Interview Questions: Do you have any previous customer service experience?

title: Content Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (San Francisco, CA) in Dec 2008
Interview Descriptions: This interview consisted of a phone interview and a half day of in-person interviewing. The phone interview was friendly. At the in-person interviews, everyone was friendly and professional. However, despite inquiries, I was never informed that I would be giving a presentation. Luckily I had prepared slides anyway, though these slides were prepared for a scientific audience. Presentation attendees were not company scientists, and questions received were largely from a popular science perspective. These are things to be prepared for if you interview with this company: prepare a presentation for a general audience. If you are coming from a bench science background, also be prepared to explain several times why you are choosing not to do a bench science post doc.
Interview Questions: I read a study about some people in Japan who have low cancer incidence. What do you think about that?

title: Senior Fellow (Post Doc) Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2008
Interview Descriptions: the hiring process include a full day interview with the lab Principal Investigator and the lab members.
Interview Questions: now that you finished your graduate school, you will need to work independently on your project, do you feel you can make this transition? why do you think that?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington in Oct 2008
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through HuskyJobs, and waited a couple of weeks for the application period to close.  An online screening process led to a first interview that was conducted on the phone.  Then after my manager decided that I was a strong candidate we set up a time to meet in person to discuss further whether or not I was a good fit for this position.
Interview Questions: How are you qualified to work in this domain?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (University, WA) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions: They are reasonable, specific, and know what they want.  If you have a year's experience, as I had from temping, you should feel fairly confident about this experience.  Also, be sure to be as thorough with your resume and your understanding of it as you can.  It will aid in your confidence in the process.  That's it!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: CLUE Tutor Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: They ask you to come down to the office.  Once there, the hiring manager gives you a test on the subject to see if you are able to solve the problems.  You are then asked to explain how you solved it to him/her.  They are testing how well you can teach or explain difficult concepts.
Interview Questions: Can you explain to me how to do this problem (on practice exam based on your academic subject)?

title: Research Scientist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: I met everyone in the lab, and interviewed directly with the lab manager and another investigator.
Interview Questions: Faced with a managerial issue, how would you handle a confrontation with a co-worker and/or superior?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2008
Interview Descriptions: I had 1 30 minute interview and was called to be offered the position 5 days later.
Interview Questions: Do you mind singing in the office?

title: Research Scientist III Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2008
Interview Descriptions: one interview, very casual.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: It was a standard presentation for such positions in very nice atmosphere. 45 minutes scientific talk in front of the research group and 1:1 discussion with PI about research projects, possibilities at UW for collaborations, expectations, work time (which is idealistic for such a position, as it always exceeds), help trough techs etc. Very collaborative atmosphere, unfortunaely only talked to PI and not to any other institutional professors
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Dec 2007
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very straight-forward, a presentation followed by a one on one with my future supervisor.  The atmosphere was very laid back and not in the least bit stressful.   I would say that the best indicator for success is your recommendations and the quality of your presentation.
Interview Questions: They asked quite a bit about biochemical pathways and familiarity with western blotting etc.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Washington (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2007
Interview Descriptions:
Applicants meet 1:1 with faculty to discuss faculty research and the student's past experience and research interests.  Questions were often based on the student's resume/CV and application packet.  I believe that grades and GRE scores are less important than research experience and letters of reccomendation from people within the field.

Several faculty asked what made me competitive compared to other applicants.

At lunch, all the applicants were taken to a casual local restaurant with current students in the program.
Interview Questions: What makes you more competitive than any other applicants?
